availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses W. Galloway (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Mecklenburg County, North Carolina, native. Son of John Galloway and Lucy Thompson Galloway. Married to Irene Galbraith in Maury County, Tennessee, on December 8, 1838. Father of John Galloway, Rebecca S. Galloway, Virginia Galloway, Elizabeth Galloway, and Benjamin H. Galloway. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Sheriff in Graves County in 1859. Sheriff in Graves County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 1, p. 444B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 317.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Hays, p. 452A.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Maury County, 1808-1867: Marriages 3, pp. 24-25.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1859 (Frankfort, KY: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 99.
"Local News," Hickman Courier (Hickman, KY), May 31, 1889, p. 3.
J.H. Battle, W.H. Perrin, and G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky, a History of the State, (Louisville and Chicago: F.A. Battey, 1885), p. 255.
